title: Len Bowkett
text:
Leonard "Len" Charles Bowkett (6 September 1906 – February 1976) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s, and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>ed rugby league in the 1930s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Warwickshire%20rugby%20football%20union">Warwickshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Coventry%20R.F.C.">Coventry R.F.C.</a>, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>, <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley</a> (<a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">loan</a>), and <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley</a>, as a , i.e. number 1, 3 or 4, or 6, and coached at club level for <a href="Keighley%20Cougars">Keighley</a> (<a href="Reserve%20team">A-Team</a>).
Background.
Len Charles Bowkett was born in <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a>, <a href="Warwickshire">Warwickshire</a>, he was a pupil at Broad Street School, <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a>, he was the <a href="landlord">landlord</a> of The Fleece Inn, <a href="Sheepridge%2C%20Huddersfield">Sheepridge, Huddersfield</a> in , and he died aged 69 in <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Len Bowkett took place in a trial match for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">England</a> (RU) circa-1926, and won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> (RL) while at Huddersfield in 1932 against Wales.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Len Bowkett played left-, i.e. number 4, was <a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>, <a href="player%20of%20the%20match">man of the match</a>, and scored three <a href="Penalty%20%28rugby%29%23Penalties%20in%20rugby%20league">penalties</a>, and two <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">conversion</a>s in <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s 21–17 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1932%E2%80%9333%20Challenge%20Cup">1932–33</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1932%E2%80%9333%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1932–33 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 6 May 1933, receiving the trophy from <a href="Edward%20VIII">Edward, Prince of Wales</a>.
County Cup Final appearances.
Len Bowkett played left-, i.e. number 4, and scored a <a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a> in <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s 2–10 defeat by <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="1930%E2%80%9331%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1930–31</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1930%E2%80%9331%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1930–31 season</a> at <a href="Thrum%20Hall">Thrum Hall</a>, <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax</a> on Saturday 22 November 1930, played left-, i.e. number 4, and scored a <a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a> in the 4–2 victory over <a href="Hunslet%20R.L.F.C.">Hunslet</a> in the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1931–32</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1931–32 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 21 November 1931.
Club career.
Len Bowkett played two matches while on <a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">loan</a> from <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> to <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley</a> in April 1936; the 12–9 victory over <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> at <a href="Mount%20Pleasant%2C%20Batley">Mount Pleasant</a>, <a href="Batley">Batley</a> on Saturday 11 April 1936, and the 7–10 defeat by <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> at <a href="Mather%20Lane">Mather Lane</a> (adjacent to the <a href="Bridgewater%20Canal">Bridgewater Canal</a>), <a href="Leigh%2C%20Greater%20Manchester">Leigh</a> on Easter Monday 13 April 1936.
Genealogical information.
Len Bowkett's marriage to Jessie (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Taylor) was registered during first ¼ 1926 in <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a> district. They had children; June Bowkett (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DSBpNLPGNhqsT4DuAZb0lEA%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during second ¼ 1926 in <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a> district), John L. Bowkett (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3D0WWGjERCNcNmsMFCG4hb0g%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during third ¼ 1931 in <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a> district), Roland G. Bowkett (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DfWWpfQQSzHa1S3hLp8HeAg%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during third ¼ 1937 in <a href="Coventry">Coventry</a> district),
